--- In rest-discuss@yahoogroups.com, "Eric J. Bowman" <eric@...> wrote:

=
> Because the semantics of a partial update are not idempotent.  

That's f=
alse.

A function f:X->X is idempotent if f(f(x)) =3D f(x). 

If X=3DAxB an=
d f sets the 2nd element to b0, so f(a,b) =3D (a, b0) then f(f(a,b))=3D f(a=
,b0) =3D (a,b0) =3D f(a,b) so f is idempotent. And f is clearly a "partial =
update", it updates the second element and not the first.
